section.heading: Limitations on expenditures and obligating amounts.
section.text: A District agency head, deputy agency head, agency fiscal officer, agency budget director, agency controller, manager, or other employee may not:

para.text: Make or authorize an expenditure or obligation exceeding an amount available in an appropriation for an agency, fund, or capital project;

Obligate the District for the payment of money before an appropriation is made or before a certification of the availability of funds is made, unless authorized by law; provided, that this paragraph shall not prohibit the acceptance of voluntary services or employment of personal services exceeding that authorized by law during emergencies involving the safety of human life or the protection of property;
Approve a disbursement without appropriate authorization;
Defer recording a transaction incurred in the current fiscal year to a future fiscal year;
Allow an expenditure or obligation to exceed apportioned amounts;
Fail to submit a required plan or projection in a timely manner;
Knowingly report incorrectly on spending to date or on projected total annual spending;
Fail to adhere to a spending plan through overspending that is greater than 5% of the agency’s budget, or $1 million, regardless of the percentage; or
Make or authorize an expenditure or obligation for one capital project from another capital project.
